actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to amend the National Labor Relations Act to provide that a labor organization is not required to provide legal representation to an employee in an arbitration proceeding if such employee is not a member of such labor organization.

summary.text: Amends the National Labor Relations Act to stipulate that it shall not be an unfair Labor practice for a labor organization, which has agreed upon a method for the settlement of grievance disputes arising over the application or interpretation of an existing collective-bargaining agreement, to refuse to provide or defray the cost of an attorney for any nonunion employee involved in any such settlement procedure.

titles.title: A bill to amend the National Labor Relations Act to provide that a labor organization is not required to provide legal representation to an employee in an arbitration proceeding if such employee is not a member of such labor organization.
